page.title: 02LODGE FARM, GASTHORPE
page.content: Lodge Farm is run by Mr. Kemp and his four men. He grows barley and sugar beet. He does not have animals although there was a horse stud until about 40 years ago. The most successful of his crops is the winter barley. It covers 500 of the 780 acres, 130 acres is sugar beet and the rest is grass. The crops are usually harvested in late July and August. Mr. Kemp uses 4 tractors, 2 Massey- Fergesons and a combine harvester. The people who work on the farm live in Gasthorpe, Garboldisham and Blo Norton. The present farmers on this land are moving soon because the land owners are repossessing the farm.
